faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: For the Fall semester, early action applications are due by November 1st, and regular decision applications are due by January 15th. Spring semester applications are due by October 1st.
faq.q2: Do I need to take the IELTS/TOEFL?
faq.a2: International applicants whose primary language of instruction was not English are required to submit English proficiency scores. We accept IELTS (minimum 6.5) or TOEFL iBT (minimum 80).
faq.a3: Yes, ZhezU offers fee waivers for students who demonstrate financial need. Please contact the admissions office with supporting documentation before submitting your application.
faq.q4: Can I apply to multiple programs?
faq.a4: You may apply to a primary and a secondary choice of major within your application. If you are not accepted to your first choice, you will automatically be considered for your second choice.

about.pageDescription: About O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University — history, mission, departments
about.intro: O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University is one of the leading higher education institutions in the Ulytau region. For over 65 years, we have been training highly qualified specialists for the mining industry, education, and economics.

history.title: University History
history.p1: Zhezkazgan University was founded in 1961 as a branch of Karaganda Polytechnic Institute to train engineers for the region's mining and metallurgical industries.
history.p2: Over the decades, the institution has grown into a multidisciplinary university with 5 departments, 22 bachelor's programs and 3 master's programs, training world-class specialists.

timeline.1961: Founded as a branch of Karaganda Polytechnic Institute
timeline.2024: AI Center launch and digital transformation

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: Training highly qualified, competitive specialists capable of innovative activity and continuous professional development in the interests of the Ulytau region and the country.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To become the leading university in Central Kazakhstan, a recognized center for mining education, scientific research and innovation, integrated into the international educational space.

mission.pageDescription: Mission, vision, values and strategic goals of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University
mission.title: University Mission & Vision
mission.intro: O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University is a dynamically developing educational, scientific and cultural center of the Ulytau region, providing a wide range of educational and research services.
mission.missionQuote: Training professional competent graduates capable of creating and strengthening the innovation potential of the region and the country.
mission.missionText: The university trains specialists for the information society, introduces innovative training programs, develops new teaching technologies and builds partnerships with government agencies and business.
mission.visionQuote: To take a leading position as a practice-oriented university in Kazakhstan for training highly qualified specialists in mining and metallurgical, economic and pedagogical specialties.
mission.visionText: The university strives to become a leading practice-oriented institution with deep integration into the international scientific and educational space, ensuring a high level of scientific research in priority areas of innovative economic development.
mission.strategicText: Creating conditions for the dynamic development of Zhezkazgan University as a multidisciplinary university and base center for training teachers and engineers in the Ulytau region, effectively contributing to staffing, scientific-methodological and information-technological support of the innovative development of the national education system.

rector.pageDescription: Takishov Abdilmalik Argynovich — President-Rector of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University, D.Sc., Professor
rector.title: President-Rector of the University
rector.subtitle: Takishov Abdilmalik Argynovich heads O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University — the only multidisciplinary higher education institution in the Ulytau region.

bio.p1: Takishov Abdilmalik Argynovich is a Doctor of Technical Sciences, Professor, and Academician of the Kazakhstan National Academy of Natural Sciences. He heads Zhezkazgan University named after O.A. Baikonurov as President-Rector.
bio.p2: Under his leadership, the university has significantly strengthened its position as a leading educational and scientific center of the Ulytau region. In September 2010, the rector signed the Bologna Declaration in Bologna (Italy), and Zhezkazgan University joined the Magna Charta Universitatum, confirming the university's integration into the international educational space.
bio.p3: For the high quality of specialist training for industry, under the leadership of Takishov A.A., the university was awarded the Gold Medal of the Association for the Promotion of Industry SPI (Paris) and the international Golden Ingot Award in the 'Effectively Developing Enterprise' nomination (Amsterdam).

academicCouncil.pageDescription: Academic Council of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University — composition, functions, activities
academicCouncil.title: University Academic Council
academicCouncil.subtitle: The highest collegial governing body for academic and research activities of the university
academicCouncil.aboutP1: The Academic Council of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University is the highest collegial governing body for the university's academic, research and educational activities. The Council determines strategic development directions and makes decisions on key educational policy issues.
academicCouncil.aboutP2: The composition of the Academic Council was approved by order dated September 17, 2021. Its members include the Rector, Pro-Rectors, Department Heads, leading professors and associate professors, as well as student government representatives.
academicCouncil.functionsSubtitle: Key areas of activity of the University Academic Council

strategy.title: Strategic Planning
strategy.text: Defining priority development areas, approving strategic plans and development programs.

academic.title: Academic Activities
academic.text: Approving curricula, educational programs, and procedures for organizing the educational process.

science.title: Research Activities
science.text: Defining research directions, approving dissertation topics, coordinating scientific work.

degrees.title: Academic Titles
degrees.text: Reviewing matters of conferring academic titles, recommendations for dissertation defense.

quality.title: Education Quality
quality.text: Monitoring the quality of specialist training, analyzing accreditation results and external assessments.

docs.title: Regulatory Documents
docs.text: Approving internal regulatory documents, provisions, and operational regulations of divisions.

academicCouncil.compositionP1: The Academic Council includes heads of structural divisions, leading scholars and faculty members, representatives of employers and student government.
academicCouncil.compositionP2: The full composition of the council is approved by the Rector's order dated September 17, 2021. Meetings are held at least once a month during the academic year.

accreditation.pageDescription: National accreditation and certification of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University
accreditation.title: Accreditation and Quality
accreditation.subtitle: Zhezkazgan University confirms educational quality through national and international accreditation, quality management system certification
accreditation.aboutP1: O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University consistently undergoes state attestation and independent accreditation procedures, confirming that educational programs meet national and international standards.
accreditation.aboutP2: The university's quality management system has been certified to the international ISO 9001 standard since 2006. In 2010, the university joined the Magna Charta Universitatum, confirming its integration into the Bologna Process.
accreditation.standardsSubtitle: The university meets key national and international education quality standards

state.title: State Accreditation
state.text: State accreditation issued by the Ministry of Education and Science of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Certificate A No. 0000035 dated August 3, 2001 confirms the university's compliance with state higher education standards.

iqaa.title: IQAA Accreditation
iqaa.text: The Independent Agency for Quality Assurance in Education (IQAA) conducted institutional accreditation of the university. In 2019, specialized program accreditation of educational programs was carried out.

iso.title: ISO 9001
iso.text: The university's quality management system has been certified to the international standard ISO 9001:2000 since 2006, confirming the effectiveness of the education quality management system.

bologna.title: Bologna Process
bologna.text: In September 2010, the rector signed the Bologna Declaration in Bologna, Italy. Zhezkazgan University joined the Magna Charta Universitatum, confirming its integration into the European Higher Education Area.

internationalAccreditation.title: International Recognition
internationalAccreditation.subtitle: Zhezkazgan University is integrated into the international educational space and has recognition from leading international organizations
internationalAccreditation.aboutP1: O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University actively develops international relations and consistently undergoes international accreditation procedures. The university is a participant in the Bologna Process and a member of the Magna Charta Universitatum.
internationalAccreditation.aboutP2: For the high quality of specialist training, the university has received international awards from leading European organizations, confirming its status as a recognized educational center.
internationalAccreditation.achievementsSubtitle: Key international awards and recognition of the university

magna.title: Magna Charta Universitatum
magna.text: In September 2010, Rector Takishov A.A. signed the Bologna Declaration in Bologna, Italy. Zhezkazgan University joined the Magna Charta Universitatum — an international association of over 900 universities from 88 countries, affirming commitment to principles of academic freedom and institutional autonomy.

spi.title: SPI Gold Medal
spi.text: For the high quality of specialist training for industry, the university received the Gold Medal of the Association for the Promotion of Industry (Société de l'industrie minérale — SPI) in Paris — one of the prestigious awards in mining and engineering education.

gold.title: Golden Ingot International Award
gold.text: The university was awarded the international Golden Ingot Award in the 'Effectively Developing Enterprise' nomination (Amsterdam), confirming the high level of management and dynamic development of the university at the international level.

iso.title: ISO 9001 — International Standard
iso.text: The university's quality management system is certified to the international standard ISO 9001:2000, which is recognized worldwide as the benchmark for quality management in organizations.

rankings.pageDescription: Positions of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University in national and international rankings
rankings.title: University Rankings
rankings.subtitle: Positions of Zhezkazgan University in national and international ranking systems
rankings.rankingsSubtitle: The university is represented in leading national and international ranking systems

national.title: IQAA National Ranking
national.text: The university participates in the National Ranking of Leading Universities of Kazakhstan conducted by the Independent Agency for Quality Assurance in Education (IQAA). The ranking evaluates universities across six categories.

webometrics.title: Webometrics
webometrics.text: In the Webometrics ranking, which evaluates the web presence and digital activity of universities, ZhezU holds the 77th position among Kazakh universities by visibility and impact indicators.

edurank.title: EduRank
edurank.text: The international EduRank ranking evaluates universities by scientific publications and citations. ZhezU is among 108 Kazakh universities represented in this ranking.

unirank.title: UniRank
unirank.text: The international UniRank directory ranks over 14,000 universities worldwide. Zhezkazgan University holds the 77th position among Kazakh universities.

rankings.aboutP1: University rankings are an important tool for evaluating education quality. Zhezkazgan University participates in both national (IQAA) and international (Webometrics, EduRank, UniRank) ranking systems.
rankings.aboutP2: As the only multidisciplinary university in the Ulytau region, the university focuses on training specialists for mining, metallurgy, education, and engineering industries. The 87% graduate employment rate demonstrates high demand for specialists in the labor market.

partners.pageDescription: Corporate and industry partners of O.A. Baikonurov Zhezkazgan University
partners.title: Corporate Partners
partners.subtitle: Zhezkazgan University develops partnerships with leading enterprises in mining, energy, and construction industries of the Ulytau region
partners.aboutP1: As the only multidisciplinary university in the Ulytau region, Zhezkazgan University is a key supplier of qualified personnel for regional enterprises. The university maintains and develops cooperation with government and business structures, public organizations and enterprises.
partners.aboutP2: The mining industry is a priority area of Kazakhstan's industrial and innovation development. The university trains specialists in mining, geology, metallurgy, energy, construction and mechanical engineering, who are in demand at enterprises in the Zhezkazgan region.
partners.industriesSubtitle: Enterprises and organizations with which the university maintains active cooperation

mining.title: Mining Industry
mining.text: Zhezkazgan is one of the largest mining centers in Kazakhstan. The university trains mining engineers, geologists and ore processing specialists for regional enterprises.
mining.partners: Kazakhmys Corporation, KAZ Minerals, Zhezkazgantsvetmet LLP

energy.partners: Kazakhmys Energy LLP, Zhezkazgan CHP, GRES

construction.title: Construction

education.title: Education

education.partners: Ulytau Region Education Department, regional schools
